page.title: 18HOP GROWING NEAR CANON PYON
page.content: Hops are grown in the N.West corner. Lisa's uncle sprays the nettles and docks to prevent them choking the hops.Polythene is put round the hops to make them grow faster.When they are ripe the hop bines are cut down from the supporting wires.Then taken by tractor and trailer back to the farm building where the{hop machine}is housed.The machine strips the hops from the bine.Lisa's Gran and aunties pick the leaves out.The hops are then put onto trays and are taken to the {'kill' (kiln)}to be dried.After drying they are put into huge polypropylene sacks called{pockets.}The fan of the hop drier is noisy and can be heard at Bush Bank during the night.Lisa belongs to a family of{travellers}who live in modern style caravans on the farm. Hop-growers have had problems with disease and over-production.
